admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
subsc: Water supply,Roads and highways,Central government administration,General agriculture, fishing and forestry sector

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall project outcome is rated
            marginally satisfactory, while overall project
            sustainability is rated uncertain. Overall World Bank
            performance was unsatisfactory: The two important aspects
            missed during project preparation were 1) a well-described
            coordination mechanism and detailed sequencing of various
            activities, and 2) a detailed control mechanism on
            procurement and provision of pesticide to farmer groups.
            Overall Borrower performance was satisfactory. The main
            lessons learned included the following: Swamp development
            requires an integrated approach including water management,
            food and tree crops production, and provision of essential
            services such as roads and water supply. Decentralized
            project design and planning involving the active
            participation of local government and other stakeholders is
            essential for defining and prioritizing real needs, thus
            improving the chances of project success. Greater
            participation on community development and a participatory
            approach in project planning, implementation, and management
            is recommended in future lowland projects. Inadequate
            consideration of environmental factors during planning and
            engineering design may lead to a serious negative impact on
            the environment and human life. Such projects such as swamp
            development projects should be implemented in phases over a
            much longer period that the typical project time-frame in
            order to accommodate community development and the proper
            sequencing of development activities.
